Title: Japan’s LNG stocks fall to their lowest winter levels in early March
Description: LNG stocks held by Japan’s power utilities have fallen for the second consecutive week and plummeted to their lowest levels this winter, according to data released today by the Ministry of Energy, Trade and Industry.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy offers one LNG cargo loading in second-half April
Description: Sakhalin Energy has issued a tender to sell one LNG cargo that will load on Apr. 22 at its 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG terminal at Russia’s Prigorodnoye port. The tender will close on Mar. 11, with bids expected to remain valid until a day later.
Author: CK

Title: UK to explore reducing Russian gas imports further, phases out Russian oil imports
Description: The UK will look into reducing already-low imports of Russian gas as part of a long-term strategy to increase energy supply security in terms of renewables, domestic oil and gas supplies as it seeks to phase out imports of Russian oil this year.
Author: CK

Title: EU seeks to reduce demand for Russian gas by two-thirds before year-end
Description: The European Commission has outlined plans to reduce its imports of Russian oil and gas and expects European demand for Russian gas can decrease by two-thirds before the year-end.
Author: CK
